explanation: To determine whether OS_Application_Startup violates the MISRA rule forbidding direct or indirect self-calls, the analysis must consider the full transitive call set reachable from OS_Application_Startup and verify none of those functions (directly or indirectly) call OS_Application_Startup. Therefore include: - Direct callees of OS_Application_Startup (OS_API_Init, OS_ApplicationExit, UtTest_EarlyInit, UT_BSP_Setup, UtAssert_BeginTest, UtTest_Setup, UtAssert_EndTest) because any of them could directly call back to OS_Application_Startup. - All functions called by those direct callees (listed individually) because they form the next levels of the call graph that could create an indirect cycle back to OS_Application_Startup (e.g., OS_API_Init -> OS_TaskAPI_Init, UT_ExecuteBasicHandler, etc.; OS_ApplicationExit -> UT_Stub_RegisterContextWithMetaData, UT_ExecuteBasicHandler; UtTest_EarlyInit -> UtList_Create; UT_BSP_Setup -> OS_BSP_GetArgC/ArgV/UT_BSP_DoText; UtAssert_* -> UT_BSP_Lock/Unlock/StartTestSegment/DoText/DoTestSegmentReport). Each listed symbol is therefore required to inspect whether any path from OS_Application_Startup can eventually call OS_Application_Startup (i.e., to detect indirect recursion).
